item.title: The $200,000 milestone archived
item.description: In 2021 I set myself ambitious goal to reach S$1,000,000 net worth (excluding property) in 5 years. I’m trilled to announce that I’m still on track. Today I will describe my bumpy road to current milestone.

item.title: The first year learning and mistakes
item.description: The first time I got my feet wet with the world of finance and investments was the middle of 2020. But only by the end of the year I really developed my interest and started proactively learning and trying new things. As any student I did mistakes. And today I want to go through some of them.

item.title: The $100,000 milestone archived
item.description: Less than half a year ago I published a list of my financial goals and now I’m pleased to report the second milestone, S$100,000 net worth, is archived! It also coincided with the end of the year, so I’ll use the opportunity to do the year end review.

item.title: Cash accounts
item.description: In my previous post, I already touched on the topic of cash accounts while choosing where to keep my emergency fund. Today I want to elaborate on it more. What products are available in Singapore, and why do I use them.

item.title: Saving and Investment accounts overview
item.description: This post describes some of my current accounts, what is the reasoning behind each of them.

item.title: Budget and expense tracking
item.description: To kick-off my investment journey, the first step was to make a budget. And to make a budget, I needed to know my expenses.

item.title: Let's start
item.description:
Hello there!

In this blog, I want to share my finance and investment journey as an Ang Mo (white person) in Singapore.

It might be useful for young foreigners in a similar situation as I am. It could be interesting for the more general public as most of the learnings are universal or it can be read just for laughs.
